page.title: 07MR. ROBINSON OF TOW LAW.
page.content:
We spoke to some of the people who have lived in Tow Law all their lives.
{One 80 year old, Mr Robinson, thought {that it was the friendliness of the {local people that made him not want to {move away.
"Since 1945 new estates have been built and the railway closed in the 1960's. I remember having to catch the train to go shopping in Crook (4 miles). Few traces of the railway now remain."
"The old back-to-back houses have all been altered or demolished but I can still remember the days when I worked in the office of a local colliery."
